name: SuiteDreams Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SuiteDreams is a lovely little gem of a hotel in a wonderful location. The hotel is simply but beautifully furnished with wonderful modern en suite bathrooms, very comfortable bedding, and generous closet/storage space for a week's stay. The breakfast each morning is a feast both the eyes and the palate and is served in a lovely little breakfast room. During our stay we enjoyed the wonderful Italian yogurt, the delicious coronetti, croissants, fresh fruit, ham and cheese and execellent coffee. The hotel is situated on the first floor and has a lift which will accommodate two guests with luggage. The hotel's common areas and rooms are impeccably clean and very quiet.
reviews.title: A perfect little gem in Rome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at SuiteDreams is friendly, helpful, and courteous. They take great pride in making your stay in Rome as wonderful as possible by providing restaurant recommendations, reservations and even a DVD player with videos after an especially tiring day. The location near Piazza Repubblica is a few short blocks to a Metro station and a taxi stand and many sites are nearby. Most tourist sites are a mile or less from the hotel and walking is very pleasant. We can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Superb hotel - totally recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: We stayed at Suite Dreams for 2 nights whilst in Rome for a weekend and I can say how great this hotel is. The location is ideal only a 10-15 minute walk to the historical centre of Rome and 2 mins from the Metro which takes you over to the Vatican.
reviews.title: A Perfect Little Hotel in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family

reviews.title: A great place to stay in rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at SuiteDreams for three nights in early May 2012. We found the front desk staff very helpful by providing luggage storage for us before check-in and helping us with directions and restaurant reservations. They even loaned us a European electrical adapter. The roomnames are a little quirky, they're either a letter or a colour. Our room was "Blue". It was spacious, quiet, and very clean, with a modern look and free WiFi. Breakfast was included and was excellent... everything you need to start the day. There are many restaurants in the area and Suite Dreams is very close to a Metro station, which will get you close to many of the famous tourist sites if you don't like to walk. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: High quality hotel in the heart of Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple

It is in a fantastic location to walk or catch a taxi to anywhere in the city for cheap. We ate at several nearby restaurants as well as visited the local deli's and grocery to bring back late night snacks to the room.
reviews.title: Top Notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple

They moved all the tables for us and arranged everything so we could have our NY day ..private yoga session for 2012. Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in two adjacent and symmetrical rooms (blue and green). Rooms were very modern and very clean. The bathrooms were spacious and clean. The beds were quite comfortable. Each room had an electronically operated shutter that opens and completely shuts. The hotel was conveniently located within walking distance from the train station and just next to a metro station. The staff seemed a bit passive but very helpful when asked. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and they gave us a list. We tried three of them that were close by and they were all very good!
reviews.title: Clean and modern rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rome is an expensive place for accommodation and when visiting with a family, the costs do add up. Suite Dreams offers spacious, value for money family rooms that can take the some of the financial pain away when visiting this amazing city. It is well located and has a metro station nearby. The noise levels from the street be quite loud so one has to remember to close the metal window screens in the bathroom and bedroom that bring the noise down to a tolerable level. For those who are less tolerant to noise, I would recommend bringing some earplugs. Service and breakfast are fine and wi-fi is free so there is little else one could ask for. It can be hard to find especially at night so follow the instructions strictly as there isn't a big frontage. Just look for the name on the buzzer panel.
reviews.title: Good value family rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The reviews on TripAdvisor were quite good. This is a great, clean, rather spacious (based on other feedback on other hotels) room. The free wi-fi worked great, the front desk staff was always friendly and helpful, and the room was great. Also the location so close to Repubblica Metro station was a great bonus. It made getting around Rome quite easy. It was also reasonably quiet, and the AC in the room worked great. We didn't eat the breakfast because of the price (15 euros), and the face that a 1.50 euro cappucino and a 1 euro croissant at any of the local coffee shops was enough for us at breakfast. We saved the big meals for lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: What we needed, nothing more, nothing less

Beyond the doors the building's large entrance hall. The hotel occupies the first floor of a traditional building, that you can get to it via stairs or a small lovely 'old fashioned' lift.

reviews.text: We were not disappointed with our first impressions of the hotel - modern, clean, simple and fresh. We were warmly greeted and throughout our stay were made very welcome, nothing was too much trouble. Even before we arrived we were helped to get tickets for La Traviata.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have nothing but great things to say about Suite Dreams. Location was great - we walked or took the subway at Plaza Republica to get everywhere. Our room was perfect-good size, plenty of storage, good bathroom and great bed - we slept so well each night! The staff was wonderful...we got in early and we're able to easily clean up and store our luggage...they had great recommendations for dining and touring Rome...they were able to change our Vatican Museum reservation for us when we realized we were overbooked..they had a chilled bottle of champage waiting for us to celebrate my husbands's 50th birthday. And breakfast each day was delicious - we especially loved the capuccino machine!
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!

reviews.text: Spent 4 nights at this hotel and can't recommend it enough. The location is very convenient - walking distance to Termini train station, Republica for metro, and of course all the main sites - Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, Trevi, etc. The staff spoke perfect English and were very keen to help with everything. The room was v clean and spacious, wifi was free (and very reliable), as were breakfast and a couple of bottles of water each day. The only slight complaint was that my room (f) was very close to reception desk and could hear some of the entrance's noise late at night - very room-specific complaint and wasn't serious enough to spoil the experience. Highly recommended.

good option while in Rome
reviews.text: I couldn't quite make myself give this hotel a 5 because I felt it was very expensive for what we got. However, I think that Rome is an extremely expensive city to visit so it is probably a good price for Rome. The room was nice - nothing spectacular, but definitely no complaints. The room was decorated in a minimalist style, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very modern. What really makes this place stand out is the service. My fiancé had arranged for a bottle of wine to be put in our room for our arrival, and the staff was very helpful in arranging this. We arrived in Rome in the morning, so we went to the hotel to drop off what baggage we had (most had not arrived on our flight) and let us freshen up. The staff offered to call the airlines on our behalf to find out about our lost baggage, and when we returned later in the day, they reported to us that the airlines had no idea where our bags were! At least they tried. The staff also made lots of suggestions for us to help us plan our day. They let us store our bags the morning of the day we left so we could explore a little more of the city. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome - I am just glad rooms in the rest of Italy were not as expensive!

reviews.title: Very Good but not sure our high expectations were met
reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend staying at Suite Dreams with our young daughter. We had very high expectations from reading the Trip Advisor reviews. This property is in an ok position in the City, however, due to the very hot weather we found walking too far with our daughter not an enjoyable experience and took full advantage of the reasonable taxi service. Our room was modern with a double bed (2 singles together) and a separate bed for our daughter. The mattresses firm and ok but not madly comfortable. Ample wardrobe space and a spacious modern and clean bathroom. Bring your own travel kettle and supplies if you like tea/coffee in your room. I couldn't sleep at 4am due to the room being too hot, and try as I may I could not get the air conditioning unit to come on, so that was an uncomfortable night. Unlike most "hotels" there is no information booklet in the room. Personally we felt this would have been very helpful, certainly regarding the immediate area (restaurants, facilities, bus tours, metro etc). There is a recommended restaurant list at reception but it is under a glass top and not apparently available to take away. Unfortunately we were unable to connect our laptop to the WiFi, but there is free internet access for guests we used. We had a view of a side street and a fair amount of traffic noise from the nearby main road, especially during the week. Breakfast was a fairly basic continental affair. One morning there was a gorgeous fresh fruit salad, but that was the only day out of four we were there. Staff on the reception were helpful - some more than others, but no-one unpleasant. All spoke good English, apart from the gentleman on the evening we arrived.

reviews.title: Wonderful first impression of Rome
reviews.text: We were happy eating out at local restaurants, and if you take the time to wander away from the main thoroughfares you are rewarded with great Italian Cafe/Bars.

reviews.title: Modern rooms, great service, centrally located, walk to attractions
reviews.text: We took a tour with the 110 bus service. 15 euros per adult for a 24 hour ticket. Takes two hours to do a full City Tour, which you can hop off and on at all the major stops, and you pick the bus up a few minutes walk from Suite Dreams.

reviews.title: Good base for exploring Rome
reviews.text: One general tip is regarding taking a taxi to/from the City from Rome Ciampino Airport. There is a flat 30 euro fare - do not be tempted by the rogue taxi drivers who offer a fare for more than this (one aggressive taxi driver on the night we arrived wanted 60 euros - and he got a couple of women to agree to it). There appeared to be some sort of security guard overseeing the taxi rank and the police nearby, but they completely ignored the rogue driver who caused an obstruction with his taxi, and was clearly flouting the 30 euro rule.

We only decided at the very last minute that we were going to travel with our 10 month old baby and hence had not informed the hotel. reviews.title: Highly recommend.....great stay!
reviews.text: We arrived early (9am) and had arranged for an airport transfer. The lovely lady at the desk informed us that the room was not ready. She cheerfully gave us a map and showed us the directions to the Trevi and the Pantheon. It is a comfortable 15 mins walk to Trevi via an underground route and we passed many nice small boutiques along the way. The children were kept happy with heaps of gelato shops around the hotel .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from Italy and already have a plan to go back next year. We stayed 3 nights at Suite Dreams in Rome and couldn't ask for any better place and service. Our luggage was delayed for a couple of days. One of the staff, the lovely Roma called the airline to follow up on it everyday. Everyone at Suite Dreams is very friendly and helpful. The hotel also owns a small restaurant outside the city center called Osteria Chiana. If you have a chance, please try it. It was one of the best meals we had in Rome. Thanks again for the wonderful stay Federico, Pierfrancesco, Frankie, Roma and everyone else who we forgot the names. See you next year!!!
reviews.title: Great stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on a split stay of 2 nights on the front end and 2 nights on the back end of our vacation to Italy. The owner, Francesco (Piero) is such an incredible individual who has taken the concept of lodging to a whole new level. His entire staff is customer friendly oriented and the customer is really treated like their own family. The rooms are extremely clean with a beautifual modern design. There are soundproof windows, flat screen tv, wood floors, modern tiled shower and bathroom. These are very good size rooms for Rome (actually quite big by Rome standards). The attention to detail in cleanliness and decoration is quite apparent. Also, the entire staff speaks English as well as many other languages. We were provided with a long list of restaurants and went to 2 of them which proved to be incredible. The hotel is within walking distance to Roma Termini ( the main train/subway terminal) of Rome. We actually brought our 3 pieces of luggage and walked from the Termini to Suite Dreams. However, you can also jump on the A line of the metro and go from Termini Metro to the Repubblica ( a one minute ride) and then only walk two blocks to the hotel. The hotel is in a very central and active location in Rome. I think it is safer than near the Vatican. The Vatican area at night is very quite and not much is going on. I would stay here at Suite Dreams again. Breakfast is very delicious with ham and cheesed, fresh fruits, juice, American coffee, Italian espresso, croissants, cookies etc...If you order through the website, they include it in the price. Also, You would be a fool not to stay here if going to Rome!
reviews.title: Cleanest Hotel I've ever stayed in!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a hotel nightmare on both my arrival and departure. Due to total stupidity on my part, I arrived at the hotel with both a 52 euro taxi bill (you do not want to know the details, but trust me, you are smarter than I am), and no money to pay it. I went up to check in and asked if they could pay the taxi and add it to my bill. This is not a way to make a good first impression, but with scarcely any hesitation, the proprietor said yes of course, and didn't blink when we hauled in enough luggage to embarrass a movie star. We also had to catch a 7 am flight at the end of our stay, and they graciously arranged for a car and driver to take us to the airport for the same cost as a taxi. He arrived promptly at 4 am, as scheduled, and hauled the ridiculous amount of luggage for us.

reviews.title: Fun

likes.liked: — The design, comfort, the owner, location, value.
likes.disliked: — We had a puddle of water coming out from under the bed after it was raining. Also we didn't have warm water for a day, but unfortunately we found out about it during the night, when nothing could have been done. it was fixed the next day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am returning next year with my fiance to prove to him just how perfect this hotel was!
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique hotel

description: little design boutique hotel at the first floor of a residential building in the heart of Rome.10 minutes walk from Coliseum, 5 minutes walk from the train station, 1 block from Repubblica metro station. 24 hours doorman, breakfast room, free wi-fi internet, free water in the minibar!
